replies.msg:
A break for Modric at La Rosaleda


Zinedine Zidane will not take risks with Luka Modric and he won't travel to Malaga for Sunday's league match.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/04/14/5ad10683268e3eab058b4692.html

Familiar faces in the semi-final: James, Heynckes, Robben, Kroos


https://en.as.com/en/2018/04/13/football/1523641302_969119.html

Real Madrid - Bayern: No "fear clause" for James


UEFA does not allow such clauses in loan contracts, meaning Heynckes will be able to field James against his former club in the Champions League semi-final.

A 'fear clause' is the agreement between two clubs that a loan player will not be able to play against their parent club. Real Madrid and Bayern Munich will meet in the Champions League semi-final and Colombia international James Rodríguez is on loan at Bayern from the LaLiga side.

James availability good news for Heynckes

James will be available in both legs of the semi-final because UEFA does not allow such clauses to take effect in its competitions.

https://en.as.com/en/2018/04/13/football/1523637691_110037.html

åœ–ç‰‡ä¾†æº : ©AFP

'NO BALE PROBLEM'

Zinedine Zidane insists he has no problem with Gareth Bale despite substituting him at half-time during Real Madrid´s Champions League clash against Juventus last week.

Bale, who has been linked with a move away, was then not included in the squad for Sunday´s 2-1 win over Malaga in La Liga but Real insisted the plan had always been to rest players, including Bale and Karim Benzema, for the match.

"This is football," Zidane said on Tuesday. "I dont see either of them looking sad, they are training well.

"I spoke to the pair of them the other day, they would both like to score more goals but everyone is working well.

"It is always going to happen in a side like ours. There are players in good form and playing well but I have to be ready always to evaluate who is the best players for the team at any given time."
Dani Ceballos is expected to be Liverpool's first signing of the summer, according to reports.(Liverpool Echo)
